review: vr didnt really add much to the game for me tbh
amazing story
i wasnt able to experience the vr but i did want to leave a review for the game itself which is fantastic and if you like senuas sacrifice hellblade ii is even better

i purchased this game after playing hellblade 2 and enjoying it  i was pleasantly shocked that there was a vr version as well  after playing a good bit of it the last few days all i have to say is wow  this is what ive been looking for from vr for ages not the total immersive experience just the freedom to see everything around me in vr while playing with a controller in a chair  its an excellent game that looks great even in 2025 and even better in vr
interesting story and the combat was exciting if a bit simple  would have like to have been able to skip some of the cut scenes that i had already watched

hellblade senuas sacrifice vr edition takes an already intense and emotional journey and makes it even more powerful playing in virtual reality adds a deep personal layer of immersion that pulls you directly into senuas fractured world every whisper shadow and hallucination feels right there with you

a truly beautiful experience some folks would say its a bad vr port to that id agree there are some rough edges but the perspective of standing next to senua throughout this story more than makes up for that

i only played this game in vr and boy am i happy thats the case you are thrown into a crazy world and the vr immersion makes everything feel much more real my only negative experience with the game was that the trials on the island were a bit too long for my taste solid 910 recommended

avoid this version its not a vr game playing this is pretty much just a flat screen using a controller or keyboard and mouse    i will leave the cat here so that everybody who passes by can pet it and give it a thumbs up and awards 　　　 　　　　 　　　 　　 　　  l 　 　　 　 x

amazing game and amazing acting and some scenery makes it perfect for vr  it was quite intense at times some effects i havent seen in other games before but they work so well too bad the new one doesnt seem to have vr support the graphics are a bit dated now but id say its still decent especially the characters it is now one of my favorite vr titles
garbage port  cant play with only controllers  of crappy game about walking
fantastic 3rd person vr amazing graphics good combat dank af subject matter see sea of corpses battle area made living by senuas psychosis im buying senua2 asap

wow  what a pleasant surprise to find this game in vr   i thought it was a recent release but then realised it came out in 2018  wish i found it sooner almost 2 hrs into it but can say this is right up there in the top 3 vr games i have played  i wish more games would port over to vr in the same format  game play graphics sound are all amazing  well done ninja theory  to all the people complaining about controls just use an xbox controller  store page says that is what is supported

this game is a ethereal experience all through out masterful story telling with vast beautiful yet lonely settings this is not an all out action game this is a psychological slow burn in which all conflicts carry a weight of importance truly one of the most well balanced and powerful games i have ever played i cant recommend it enough especially on vr taking you deeper into the darkness of this celtic nightmare
good
awesome game steam moderators are fucking retards
love it 3 if youre into story telling this is your game
nice vr adaptation all good recommended
the actual game is fine but the vr edition feels like a downgrade compared to just playing the regular game on a monitor
great good
didnt really like the non vr version the vr version is more intense and made me realize why so many like this game
doesnt work i have a valve index on a 4080 its the game

i was a big fan of the regular hellblade but this vr version just exists for no reason this is just the game but your headset is your monitor and you use a gamepad vr controls arent even supported  feels like a beginners first vr mod but at least it comes with the base game so you dont have to pay any extra

this is just the normal game except instead of using your monitor you use your vr headset doesnt use vr controllers you have to play with a normal controller no particular vr features its really just the normal game also means youll get nauseous since theres no motion sickness reducing feature of any kind  theres literally no reason to play this version

havent played the nonvr version but this is one of the best vr experiences ive had and in gaming in general its a very unique game and story and the insights into psychosis are truly interesting i probably wouldnt have felt certain things so strongly without vr even if its got some small bugsglitches here and there nothing tragic combat was simple but i enjoyed it quite a bit very recommended
storytelling  graphics are amazing even more so in vr  worth it
vr you still need a controller to play so not really vr
one of the best games i ever played heavy subjects some existential questions not a typical super hero stuff too bad studio got bought by big m rip
now im having psychosis in real life
how to play in vr

quite confusing  first vr controllers not supported  it took sevral minutes to figure out that normal gamepad required  second  as vr experience  quite sad i didnt noticed 3d render quility on max settings quite poor tested on quest 3 without hdr looks extreamly dark  most terrible thing  cutscenes  is view pulling transition from 3d to 2d cinema  its idk not sure is it 3d video with parallax efect or simple 2d movie   feels awful
i shouldve played this sooner theyve put a lot of effort in the vr version
made me physically ill
significantly better than the base version they not only made the vr version fully functional they actually incorporated it into the story play this version if its an option

the game is very good experimental although the implementation in vr is not very good many times my right controller lagged and began to vibrate nonstop only restarting the game helpedi recommend playing the nonvr version  i played in quest 2
this is such an amazing game vr is a must
didnt think 3rd person for a vr game would work but wow this game pulls it off and is the definitive way to play

basically being a bonus vr port of the original it offers a different way to immerse yourself in senuas mind though i would have preferred a 1st person pov but that would have been a lot of work id imagine pro tip you can just lunch the game and put your headset on the desk and play it like a normal pc game
perfection

it is a very successful and unique game only problem is it is a bit too successful and built around psychotic break so it is really disturbing luckily i was in a relatively strong mind condition at this time and could play it to end but i wouldnt play if i felt a bit less stable

runs and plays great in vr would definitely recommend vr for a first playthrough i wish more games had similar vr support where you can play the game 3rd person game but in vr   i especially love the experimental mini view where everything looks like a toy
i was a little hesitant to try 3rd person vr game but it exceeded all my expectation  absolutely recommend this
it is very immersive game and is historically accurate but this is one scary game it really scared me and i finished the non vr version first

and so i finished for the second time one of the greatest most beautiful  stories mankind has ever seen senua is unforgettable exciting until the last seconda story the whole world should watchwhen its over the feeling is that of having left the cinema after a really fucked up movie  please just play it vr or not just play it this is one of the most beautiful experiences any person in the world should have

is in no way an actual vr game you play in third person and dont actually have the ability to use any sort of vr controller you cant even get past the start without a keyboard and let alone play the game

wow this is good on the quest  it has 3 modes desktop giant and regular where you are like another person following senua around at walking height  the vr aspect adds so much to the game  its incredible really  although the game is way easier post elden ring

amazing vr experience this is how hellblade should be played in the voices all around you the immersive environment  visual and facial expression are excellent especially when senua looks at you straight in the eye
one of the best shits i ever played via vr highly recommended

1010 played the original version 34 times already years ago and thought it was a masterpiece back then didnt really expect the vr version to be anything but a 510 minute nostalgic excursion back into a game that i had already thoroughly enjoyed well 8 hours later i wrapped it up in one single setting atmosphere and combat are just flat out visceral  vr is amazing for an experience like this could not possibly recommend enough
couldnt even start a new game had to press the end button on my keyboard to proceed

just play the normal version
the ambience and soundtrack makes for a great and creepy experience

the idea behind this game is an interesting one but the implementation is bad most of the time you will walk around and do some annoying puzzles with some unrewarding and repetitive combat sprinkled in to spice things up  if you have the money and are interested in this game buy it since it goes on 8590 sales
a really excellent vr adaptation

fantastic game on its own and even better in vr good optimization
i have to admit this far exceeded my expectations saying it was absolutely amazing would be putting it lightly as far as dark games this is now my 1 favorite dark game
first the voice acting is the best in any other game second the vr version is really amazing  totally recomend the game to anyone with a little bit of patience
4 out of 5 stars interesting story line game play in vr is different but enjoyable particularly the combat great soundtrack

what a brave adaptation and if that is not enough it was for free after buying the original pc game  i hope more companies follow this great sample and launch a vr version of their games even if it is as a pay dlc
game is stuck in intro screen

generally a weird game weird but good all these psycho vibes are kind of boring for me but whispered hints and sounds as a whole are astonishing combat in vr is amazing you feel the power of every crushing blow definitely this game proves that thirdperson games work fantastically in vr

its like a mix of gow and asgards wrath but also like a good classic goosebumps novel that leaves u saying just one more chapter ok one more last one and b4 u know it its 550am and the only reason ur finally calling it a night it cus the vr battery died so take that as u will oh the fighting it really fun and like gow in where dodging is key
wonderful
fantastic story art music deep treatment of gritty subject matter
very cool experience in vr
one of the best graphics in vr games

hellblade is one of my all time favorites the vr version is good but one thing made me stop playing it  it happened to me multiple times after being a few minutes in that the right controller suddenly starts giving feedback nonstop for no reason at the same time the buttons on it to dodge roll werent working so i died few times early and the battery soon needed to be replaced

warriorwomans journey to make the gods and demons pay for the death of her loved one also shes a bit on the mad side  more seriously this is an awsome game and wonderfull storytelling it absolutely blew my mind and gave all kind of chills good and bad i love it its one of the most underrated games ever
awesome game and must have for vr users the graphics look so good in the headset and the gameplay and story are intense hope that the sequel will have vr support too

good game probably 80 story with some light puzzles and 20 combat   the story is about a celtic warrior and her very maddening journey through norse mythology the vr aspect is more for immersion which works well as devs put a lot of effort into that the actual control is via gamepad or keyboardmouse  just know this game is closer to a highly interactive story this are no upgrades no fetch quests just senua and the darkness

no valve index controller support unfortunately some cutscenes are in 2d otherwise its a great experience the sound is awesome at first it was buggy and was unplayable but i found a post which solved most of the issues here it is  1 hit windows type env select edit system environment variables 2 click environment variables 3 under system variables click new 4 variable name opensslia32cap 5 variable value 0x200000200000000 6 click ok out through all the dialog boxes

hellblade senuas sacrifice is like dark souls and silent hill 2 had a child game is dripping with atmosphere and gives a realistic depiction of psychosis these are the selling points  play the game for these   the horror you face is internalized and as a player you have to accept the lived reality of senua in order to progress and you will be drawn into her delusional world
